thing-type.label: ZFM-80 Fixture Switch Module
thing-type.description: Fixture Switch Module<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe ZFM-80US Fixture Switch Module is a Z-Wave enabled device and fully compatible with any Z-Wave enabled network. It allows remote On/Off control of specified resistive household appliance. Each fixture switch module is designed to act as a repeater, which will re-transmit the RF signal to ensure that the signal is received by its intended destination by routing the signal around obstacle and radio dead spots.</p&gt <p&gtKey Features:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtHigh output power</li&gt <li&gtRemote ON/OFF control via the Z-Wave controller</li&gt <li&gtManual ON/OFF control with the front panel push button</li&gt <li&gtSupport External ON/OFF key connects to the module</li&gt <li&gtAdvanced function</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtConditional trigger for "Fail Safe Installation"</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSupport Network Wide Inclusion (NWI) and Explore Frames</li&gt <li&gtScrew terminals for wires connection</li&gt <li&gtFlexible mounting structure - mount inside gang box or any place</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtInclude or exclude the Fixture Switch Module from the existing ZWave home control network with your primary controller.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtRefer to your primary controller instructions to process the inclusion / exclusion setup procedure.</li&gt <li&gtWhen prompted by your primary controller, click once on the PROG button or external switch.</li&gt <li&gtThe primary controller should indicate that the action was successful. If the controller indicates the action was unsuccessful, please repeat the procedure.</li&gt <li&gtOnce the Fixture Switch Module is part of the network, the same basic procedure is used to add the Fixture Switch Module to groups or scenes. Refer to the primary controller's instructions for details.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtClick once on the PROG button or external switch.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Timeout
parameter.description: Set timeout period<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtZFM-80US provides an advanced function "Conditional trigger for Fail Safe Installation". It can turn on or turn off the relay if ZFM-80US has not received any Z-Wave commands from a specified Z-Wave Node ID and within a specified period. For example: Z-Wave gateway can monitor a Z-Wave device status and power on equipment if this Z-Wave device is out of service.</p&gt <p&gt(default value is 0 [function disabled])</p&gt</p&gt
